_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The cause and reason why some sentient b: A mendicant approves, welcomes, and keeps clinging to likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing sights and thoughts
Their consciousness relies on that and grasps it
A mendicant with grasping does not become extinguished
A mendicant doesn’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing sights and thoughts
Their consciousness doesn’t rely on that and grasp it
A mendicant free of grasping becomes extinguished.
